items.title: BOOMI Integration Developer, Architect
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=22}
items.content:
BOOMI Integration Developer, Architect at VistaVu Solutions

Remote

Anywhere North America

At VistaVu we have doubled in size over the past year and are on a very exciting trajectory. We are looking for an all-star BOOMI resource to join our team at VistaVu. The successful candidate for this role will apply agile methodologies and complex problem-solving skills to lead our system Integration efforts between SAP ERP systems and other applications leveraging the BOOMI platform for our customers. If you are “the person” we are looking for, you will be responsible for the end to end process of design, development, and operation of the system-to-system interfaces, data flows, APIs. You will coordinate the understanding of requirements, working with resources to develop any needed API’s and Architecting and developing Customer Tenants to support the Integrations and ongoing support of system monitoring, and incident resolution/escalation.

How do you know you are a fit?

  • You are experienced in requirements gathering, design, development, and operation of the system-to-system interfaces, data flows, APIs, and integration middleware as well as unit test backend applications, micro services, and integration platforms.
  • You are professionally certified in Dell BOOMI as an Architect, Administrator, and Developer.
  • You can apply agile methodologies and complex problem-solving skills to develop and deploy integration solutions in cloud, on premises, and hybrid environments.
  • Our mission is to help companies run great so it is critical you can effectively manage deadlines and release schedules.
  • Growth is a core value at VistaVu so you are constantly leading in the evaluation of industry best practices and emerging technology platforms to determine best practices and ensure we are delivering an amazing user experience to our customers.
  • We’ll trust you to get things done so you love opportunities where you think independently and drive toward success while meeting deadlines and producing high quality deliverables
  • You are results driven and work collaboratively with Product Owners and cross-functional development and business teams to design high quality integration solutions that are extensible, reusable, and secure.
  • You pride yourself in developing solutions that adhere to industry best practices in areas such as design, performance, user experience, and scalability while also ensuring the solution code-base is clean and well-documented.

What skills do you need?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related technical or business field;
  • 6+ years of full software development lifecycle and software engineering industry experience;
  • 3+ years of experience building production scale Integrations on Boomi platform
  • Certified BOOMI Architect, BOOMI Administrator and BOOMI Developer;
  • 2+ years working with Relational Databases such as MySQL or SQL Server;
  • 1+ years of experience in a lead or managerial role;
  • Experience API development using REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, Web services, WebAPI;
  • Knowledge of EAI /SOA Design Patterns and Best Practices;
  • Hands on awareness of OAuth, service bus infrastructures, scalable workflow engines;
  • Agile development experience, in a Test-Driven Development (TDD) environment with a continuous Integration/Deployment – DevOps mindset;
  • Experience or excellent awareness with front end development tools/frameworks (HTML5, JavaScript, AngularJS or React);
  • Working on enterprise-scale projects with passion for quality work and attention to detail;
  • Good written and verbal communication skills. The ability to express oneself effectively within a group and in one-to-one conversations. The ability to convey information clearly and effectively through both formal and informal documents.
  • Strong ability to organize information, manage tasks and use available tools to effectively contribute to a team and the organization.

What’s in it for you?

  • An environment where we Embrace Change, are open to Growth, where we Trust each other while we create exceptional Client Experiences.
  • Work with one of the top SAP partners in North America

Gain valuable experience marketing to diversified industries like Industrial Field Services, Life Sciences, Component Manufacturing, Aerospace & Defense.

About VistaVu Solutions

Helping North America’s mid market companies RUN GREAT is a big job, and we’re proud to do it. For over 15 years, VistaVu Solutions has been changing the way companies do business.

It’s our people who make VistaVu who we are. We are smart and determined and we’re not afraid to try new things. The team’s combined industry experience, innovative products and proven processes serve the needs of our clients in exceptional ways. Our focus is on our customer’s needs and on providing an unparalleled level of service, so that our customers can say that they truly RUN GREAT as a result of working with us.

Apply for job

items.content:
Swiftype- Integrations Engineer

Company: Elastic

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans over 100 countries.

Swiftype is a growing team of talented search engineers with a range of experiences and backgrounds. As an Integrations Engineer at Swiftype, you will take on a variety of responsibilities that will range from building example applications to showcasing the power and flexibility of the Swiftype Search platform. You'll communicate directly with customers in order to intuitively assess their needs, helping them to achieve their search goals while also refining our developer tools and knowledge base. If you see yourself as much a teacher as a coder, this position will be a terrific fit for you.

What You Will Do:

  • Excellent practical judgment. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.
  • Experience working with one or more of WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • Working knowledge of PHP.
  • Deep knowledge of a scripting language such as Ruby, JavaScript, or Python.
  • Experience working with Git and a command line.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.

What You Bring Along:

  • 2+ years experience as a web developer.
  • Experience building plugins for or customizing WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • A passion for user experience and crafting intuitive interactions on the web.
  • Experience with JavaScript tooling and libraries, like React, Vue, and jQuery.
  • Experience working with REST/JSON APIs.
  • Experience using browser tools to test, profile, and debug modern web applications.
  • Experience gathering requirements from modern design tools like Figma and Sketch.
  • Experience working with Customer Support and incorporating feedback.
  • Familiarity with Open Source projects and communities.
  • Experience writing technical blog posts and presenting at conferences.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code examples, links to personal projects, etc.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Stock options
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

How to apply:
grnh.se/116b2f8a1

items.content:
Senior Integration/ BPM Consultant

Company: Polarising
Location: Lisbon, PT
Requires Work Permit
Level: Senior
Language: Portuguese
Business Applications (BI/CRM/ERP)
Skills:
  • BPM
  • Enterprise applications
  • Git
  • SOA
  • TIBCO

    • Intro

    Polarising is a Portuguese technology company with more than 10 years of expertise in building software to fuel business success.

    Working with leading technologies like TIBCO and Spring to Integrate and Develop the best projects, Polarising has a team of more than 100 highly-skilled consultants with whom you’ll love to work with.

    Operating mainly in Europe, Polarising is the technology partner that your business can trust.

    Main requirements

    • 4+ years of experience working with Enterprise Application Integration, SOA and/or BPM principles;
    • Knowledge of one or more TIBCO products (BusinessWorks, ActiveMatrix BPM, BusinessEvents, BusinessConnect, Adapters, EMS, ActiveMatrix ServiceGrid); Mulesoft, Oracle or IBM products;
    • Excellent knowledge of Development Supporting Tools such as GIT/Subversion, Jenkins, GEMS, SoapUI;
    • Fluent in spoken and written English;
    • Leading skills, team-player, hardworking and ambitious;
    • Availability to coach junior colleagues at the Academy and/or other mentoring programs;
    • Attitude to own and take responsibility, drive to learn and grow and bring energy to the team;
    • Available to travel to Europe (for periods up to 6 months with fly-back policy).

    Perks

    We offer:

    • Full package of benefits, such as competitive salary, continuous training, a flexible
      vacation policy, possibility of working remotely and health insurance.

items.title: Blockit, Inc.: Integration Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=10, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Integration Engineer

Company: Blockit, Inc.
Headquarters: McKinney, TX
https://blockitnow.com/company/
You'll build automation integrations into a wide range of medical software for our greenfield platform. You'll have a major impact on the direction of the product’s integration strategy. You’ll be part of an experienced start-up engineering team.

We're looking for an Automation Engineer that isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. This role involves building connectors into 3rd party systems. Each integration is unique challenge and requires creativity and out-of-the box thinking.

You Will
- Build connectors/integrations into 3rd party medical systems
- Build data parsers for our data ingestion engine
- Help design the architecture for our integration and ingestion engine

Our Tech Stack
- Microservices built in Elixir, connected using GraphQL and GRPC.
- React/Redux on the frontend (not even a single line jQuery, phew!)
- Kubernetes on Google Cloud Platform, Docker, Redis, Postgres, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ
- Github and TravisCI for Development/CD.

Our Ideal Candidate
- Has experience with UI Automation (i.e, Selenium, UIPath, or AutoIT)
- Isn't afraid to drop down to Wireshark or GDB to figure out how something works
- Has worked with healthcare technology before (HL7, FHIR, etc.)
- Experience in Python
- Knowledge of (but not necessarily an expert in) writing Elixir
- Has experience consuming REST or GraphQL APIs
- Knowledge and experience of agile software development methods
- You are passionate about the quality of your code

The company is located in McKinney, TX, and has a distributed engineering team. Engineers able to work from the McKinney based office is highly preferred.

Apply for this position

sean@blockitnow.com

Swiftype- Integrations Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Elastic | No office location

Technologies

javascript

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans over 100 countries.

Swiftype is a growing team of talented search engineers with a range of experiences and backgrounds. As an Integrations Engineer at Swiftype, you will take on a variety of responsibilities that will range from building example applications to showcasing the power and flexibility of the Swiftype Search platform. You'll communicate directly with customers in order to intuitively assess their needs, helping them to achieve their search goals while also refining our developer tools and knowledge base. If you see yourself as much a teacher as a coder, this position will be a terrific fit for you.

What You Will Do:

  • Excellent practical judgment. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.
  • Experience working with one or more of WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • Working knowledge of PHP.
  • Deep knowledge of a scripting language such as Ruby, JavaScript, or Python.
  • Experience working with Git and a command line.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.

What You Bring Along:

  • 2+ years experience as a web developer.
  • Experience building plugins for or customizing WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • A passion for user experience and crafting intuitive interactions on the web.
  • Experience with JavaScript tooling and libraries, like React, Vue, and jQuery.
  • Experience working with REST/JSON APIs.
  • Experience using browser tools to test, profile, and debug modern web applications.
  • Experience gathering requirements from modern design tools like Figma and Sketch.
  • Experience working with Customer Support and incorporating feedback.
  • Familiarity with Open Source projects and communities.
  • Experience writing technical blog posts and presenting at conferences.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code examples, links to personal projects, etc.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Stock options
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply now

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

Benefits

  • 401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
  • Health Care Insurance
  • Vacation Time Determined By Location
  • Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
  • 100% Remote work possible

items.title: HRIS Integration Specialist (WorkDay) at Harris (Ottawa, ON, Canada)

items.content:
HRIS Integration Specialist (WorkDay)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Development
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Harris | Ottawa, ON, Canada

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time
Office Location: Ottawa, ON, Canada. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

edi
xml
xslt
java
.net

Job description

Harris is a leading provider of financial management and Customer Information Systems (CIS) software solutions; providing feature-rich and robust turnkey solutions to Public Sector, Schools, Utility, and Healthcare agencies throughout North America. We are a financially strong, growing and stable company guided by our values to do the right thing when it comes to our customers, our employees, and our local communities. At Harris, we offer employees the opportunity to learn and have fun, while empowering them to make a difference and directly contribute to the success of the organization!

In collaboration with our Corporate Information Technology (CIT) department, our Human Resources team is seeking an HRIS Integration Specialist to identify user requirements to design, development, and test new integrations across various cloud based SaaS applications. As such, you'll have the opportunity to learn new technologies like Learning Management Systems, Active Directory, Office 365, Centrify, Applicant Tracking, SSO, and more!

As the HRIS Integration Specialist, you will collaborate remotely with a small team of WorkDay Specialists. You will have the opportunity to work from home or you can work out of any of our east coast offices!

Details

  • Develop, document and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions.
  • Build and support custom integration solutions to SaaS systems across Harris enterprise systems
  • Manage multiple responsibilities and prioritize tasks.
  • Collaborate with IT and HR to review current Workday configurations and recommend changes and improvements.

 Qualifications

  • 3+ years of ERP, CRM, HRIS, or HCM integrating experience with a focus of Human Resources software applications.
  • A mandatory minimum of 2+ years of WorkDay systems experience.
  • 1+ years of experience designing, building, and testing WorkDay systems; including Time Tracking, Compensation and Recruiting, Reporting/Analytics, and Talent and Performance.
  • Basic knowledge of various integration technologies; such as EDI, Web Services, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net, Cloud, SaaS or other integration technologies.
  • Strong organizational skills including the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and prioritize.

 Assets

  • Working knowledge of HR best practices in a large global company environment. 
  • Workday Integration Certification (Would be considered a strong asset)

 #WeAreHarris

 Harris is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local law.

Apply now

About Harris

Founded in 2001 by a practicing family physician, Amazing Charts, LLC provides Electronic Health Record (EHR) software and services to health care providers in solo and small sized practices. Our mission is to develop an amazing practice-based medical software solution that improves the lives of our clients and their patients.

Amazing Charts, LLC is a division of Harris Computer, a member of the Constellation Software Inc. group of companies. Since 1976, Harris has focused on providing feature-rich and robust turnkey solutions to all levels of local government, public power and water entities as well as school districts throughout North America. Harris' focus is on creating long-term relationships with our customers and ensuring that we meet the changing needs of our customers over time. Harris is divided into multiple functional Business Units that are supported by a centralized Corporate Services group.

Harris is an EEO/AA/Disability/Veteran employer.

Benefits

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision
  • Generous Vacation (We actually want you to take it!)
  • Lifestyle Rewards
  • Community Involvement and Social Responsiblity
  • Fun and collaborative Work Environment
  • Competitive Salary and Stock Ownership Options
  • Opportunities to Learn and Grow
  • Flexible Work Options

items.title: Senior Data Integration Engineer at Compucorp Ltd. (London, UK)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Data Integration Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: CRM, Information Technology, Non-Profit
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Compucorp Ltd. | London, UK

Remote details

Office Location: London, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

pentaho
database
sql
mysql
api
sysadmin

Job description

Are you a data nerd? If so we want you!

We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Non Profits, Charities and Art Galleries. We’re on the lookout for a confident and ambitious Data Integration Engineer to join our fast growing startup to help us build and automate complex data integrations for our clients and platforms.

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, offer a great work-life balance with flexible working hours and a real team mentality.

Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, art galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies.

The role will comprise of 2 main elements. Most of our projects will involve a degree of data integration or migration and so we are looking to have a dedicated member of the team to work on these elements of the projects. We want to develop an automated and scalable architecture that can be used in a flexible way across large client projects.

The other element of the role will be to be part of the infrastructure team in a devops/sysadmin capacity. You would also become a key architect in helping us to develop a robust SAS platform for a major SaaS product we are developing for Non Profit Organisations around the world.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Excellent SQL skills  
  • Experience of building ETL solutions using Python (2+ years), Apache Airflow, or applicable experience with other Extract Transform and Load tools such as  Pentaho, Talend*
  • Confidence in a Linux & PHP (LAMP/LEMP) Environment
  • Previous experience with CI/DevOps tools platforms (i.e. Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Ansible) nice to have
  • Is meticulous and loves documentation!
  • Is a real team player who likes to muck in and get the job done!

*Most of our latest tools are Python based and as such we have a preference for Python skills.

What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a young team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us.

If you live and breath SQL and know your left joins from your inner joins then we would love to hear from you.

Location

At Compucorp we are a distributed team and we welcome people to join us from all around the world, however as a UK based Company some overlap with UK hours will be required. By default you should assume that your working hours would be +/- 3h max from GMT start times of 9.00AM UK start time. There is some flexibility in this but please be aware that staff members starting outside of these hours are rare and as such if you would expect these hours to be an issue for you then we would not suggest that you apply. 

For the Data Engineer role, due to EU data protection requirements, the team member must be from either an EEA country or a country that the EU considers to have adequate level of data protection. The list can be found at the link below:

https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/…

Apply now

About Compucorp Ltd.

We like to build stuff, sometimes complicated stuff, for people who like to make a difference. We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and a real team mentality. We're passionate about the platforms we work with and the communities which we are part of. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Art Galleries, Charities and NGO organisations across the country. 

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • UK Visa Sponsorship
  • Remote working
  • Flexible holidays
  • Training and development
  • Contribute to Open Source projects

items.title: .NET Integration Engineer at Travelliance (Minneapolis, MN)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=35, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
.NET Integration Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Airline Crew, Corporate Travel, Disrupted Passenger
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Travelliance | Minneapolis, MN

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time
Office Location: Minneapolis, MN. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

c#
amazon-web-services
sql
sql-server

Job description

We are looking for software engineers to enhance, maintain and manage our key software suite with the world's largest airlines. Not only will you enhance the software you will have the ability to shape and manage the future of this product by playing a key role on our integrations team.

You will work closely with airlines to invent efficiencies and innovation within the product. Travelliance currently has teams  in Chicago, Minneapolis, and Phoenix and we are looking to hire in any one of these regions.

This position has a high impact internally and externally to our customers and business units. We are a smaller team and there are plenty of meaty problems to solve. We are growing and we are looking for enthusiastic, curious, and passionate engineers to join our team to thrust our product into its next phases.

An ideal team member will have the following skills:

  • ASP.NET (C#)
  • AWS
  • Docker
  • Queue Architectures
  • SqlServer & MySQL
  • Excellent time mangement
  • Process management
  • Excellent Written Communication
  • Client Interaction Skills

The candidate will be responsible for:

  • Creating and maintaining integrations with flight operating systems
  • Buliding extensible and reusable modules
  • Writing efficient code from service to data layer
  • Maintain documentation
  • To always learn
  • To always teach
  • Other duties assigned (we are a small team after all)
Apply now

About Travelliance

Travelliance provides a suite of software and services to manage, optimize and reduce spend in lodging and transportation costs for Airlines. We are experts in airline crew logistics, hotel contracting, disrupted passenger management, and workforce accommodations.

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Competitive Medical and Dental Coverage
  • Growth and Education Opportunities

items.title: Integration Engineer at Articulate Inc.
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Integration Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: Computer Software, eLearning
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Articulate Inc. | No office location

Technologies

salesforce
marketo
javascript
integration
automation

Job description

Articulate is looking for an experienced engineer in the Sales and Marketing systems space to build solutions that will power the business at Articulate. As an integration engineer, you will be responsible for integrating the systems supporting our Marketing, Sales and Support teams at each step of the customer lifecycle. You’ll work with the business to gain a deep understanding of requirements, translate those requirements into technical specifications and implement the solutions.

Some of the tech you'll be working with includes: Salesforce, Marketo, AWS, Segment, Chargebee, JavaScript

Your ideal skills and experience:

    • 3-5 years experience implementing end-to-end systems integrations
    • Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and meet complex operational goals
    • Know Salesforce and Marketo like the back of your hand and build solutions that account for their strengths and weaknesses
    • Ability to learn a new system quickly
    • Experience investigating and solving critical production problems
    • Proven ability to identify and create solutions to improve system performance and availability
    • Strong collaborator with balanced ego
    • Very proactive and responsible
Apply now

About Articulate Inc.

Articulate is a highly successful, fully remote software company that’s changing the way the world learns. Our award-winning e-learning tools are used by 78,000+ organizations across the globe to create engaging online and mobile courses. Our customers include 93 of the Fortune 100 and 19 of the top 20 U.S. universities. And our online community of 550,000+ members is the largest, fastest-growing community in the industry.

We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We’re all free to exercise our crafts the best way we know how to reach our goals as individuals and teams. Each and every one of us is focused on producing results that directly impact the company’s success. And we all strive to do what’s right by people, both internally and externally, instead of taking the shortest route to the highest profits.

We honor people’s humanity in all of our disparate experiences and social locations, accepting each person as an individual with a story worth listening to and honoring. We believe that honoring everyone’s humanity means being committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applicants to voluntarily disclose their race and gender on our application form to help us create a diverse company. This voluntarily disclosed information will not be shared with any hiring manager and will be kept in confidence by the Articulate human resources department and executives who are not hiring for this position. Learn more about our culture.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Health care
  • Flexible vacation
  • 401k matching
  • Wellness Benefit
  • Supplemental insurance

items.title: Swiftype- Integrations Engineer at Elastic
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=77, embedded=0, frontend=47}
items.content:
Swiftype- Integrations Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Elastic | No office location

Technologies

wordpress
elasticsearch
reactjs

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Swiftype is a growing team of talented search engineers with a range of experiences and backgrounds. As an Integrations Engineer at Swiftype, you will take on a variety of responsibilities that will range from building example applications to showcasing the power and flexibility of the Swiftype Search platform. You'll communicate directly with customers in order to intuitively assess their needs, helping them to achieve their search goals while also refining our developer tools and knowledge base. If you see yourself as much a teacher as a coder, this position will be a terrific fit for you.

What You Will Do:

  • Excellent practical judgment. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.
  • Experience working with one or more of WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • Working knowledge of PHP.
  • Deep knowledge of a scripting language such as Ruby, JavaScript, or Python.
  • Experience working with Git and a command line.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.

What You Bring Along:

  • 2+ years experience as a web developer.
  • Experience building plugins for or customizing WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • A passion for user experience and crafting intuitive interactions on the web.
  • Experience with JavaScript tooling and libraries, like React, Vue, and jQuery.
  • Experience working with REST/JSON APIs.
  • Experience using browser tools to test, profile, and debug modern web applications.
  • Experience gathering requirements from modern design tools like Figma and Sketch.
  • Experience working with Customer Support and incorporating feedback.
  • Familiarity with Open Source projects and communities.
  • Experience writing technical blog posts and presenting at conferences.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code examples, links to personal projects, etc.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Stock options
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.



Apply now

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

Benefits

  • 401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
  • Health Care Insurance
  • Vacation Time Determined By Location
  • Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
  • 100% Remote work possible

items.title: Integrations Engineer (m/f) at FreightHub GmbH
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=18, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Integrations Engineer (m/f)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Logistics and Supply Chain
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: FreightHub GmbH | No office location

Technologies

node.js
docker
reactjs
typescript
mongodb

Job description

Our platform heavily relies on integrations with partners and data providers. These are some examples of integrations that are built by Integrations Engineers @FreightHub:

    • Integrations with ocean carriers, airlines, ports, and trucks to get real-time location data of our shipments
    • Warehouse integrations to understand packing and storage status of the goods
    • Integrations with Customs agents
    • Integrations with our Customers
    • Tools and Techniques to support faster development

How Integrations Engineers @FreightHub work:

    • We’re a team full of engineers that kick-down-doors to get the job done. If it isn’t defined, we find out what we need to do to improve the business
    • We over-communicate and surround ourselves in context so we can make good decisions
    • We have a long-term philosophy
    • We believe that the right process will produce the right results
    • We add value to the organization by developing our team
    • We continuously solve root problems to drive organizational learning
    • We prefer individuals and interactions over processes and tools
    • We favor working software over comprehensive documentation
    • We enjoy customer collaboration more than contract negotiation
    • We will rather responding to change over following a plan

#yourprofile

    • You know TypeScript, or are familiar with at-least ES6 and one typed language. You should be able to explain how the “this” keyword works in JS.
    • You understand DDD. Especially with regards to isolating business needs and technical solutions.
    • You embrace the Ports and Adapters way of thinking about applications.
    • You embrace 12 Factor Apps
    • You have previous experience with integrations
    • Event Logging or Event Sourcing is a technique you feel comfortable with
    • You know how HTTP, SFTP, and other transport protocols work
    • You understand JSON and RFC6902. You know XML is more than just angle-brackets and how to parse it with XPath. You can identify non-standard serializations and ways to deal with them.
    • You have experience with MongoDB and know where it can be useful
    • You have experience with Postgres and know where can be useful
    • You have a passion for testing and process improvement

#whyus

    • Be part of an international and highly professional young team (Google, BMW, DailyDeal etc.) led by serial entrepreneurs 
    • Revolutionize a global USD 450bn market
    • We are backed by top notch VC investors (Northzone, Cherry Ventures, Global Founders Capital) plus strategic advisors from the logistics industry and recently raised a USD 20M Series A round
    • Shape the company with your innovative ideas and solutions
    • Help us change and accelerate worldwide trade
Apply now

About FreightHub GmbH

#the company At FreightHub, we’re building the backbone of global trade. We are revolutionizing logistics by making it easier, faster, and more efficient to move goods from any point A to point B in the world – on container ships, airplanes, trucks and trains. By radically automating processes and designing for a superior user experience we make buying and selling goods anywhere on the globe as efficient as never before. If you want to create an impact with your work, solve real-world problems, and digitize a multi-trillion-€ industry that fosters global prosperity, we’d love you to join FreightHub!

Benefits

  • Fresh fruit, coffee, muesli and drinks
  • Weekly Monday breakfasts and Friday team events
  • Wonderful, green office space, with a terrace for barbecues
  • Subsidised sports activities

items.title: Integrations (Data) Engineer at Interfolio, Inc (Washington, DC)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=40, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Integrations (Data) Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Education, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Interfolio, Inc | Washington, DC

Remote details

Office Location: Washington, DC. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes

Technologies

etl
sql
rest
java
amazon-web-services

Job description

Integrations (Data) Engineer

Interfolio is on a mission to build smart, inspired and useful products for faculty and academic communities. By building an engine for faculty activity, decisions, and data, Interfolio has become the first mover in defining and owning the category of faculty-focused technology that cultivates goal-oriented collaboration around academic decision-making.

Interfolio operates the first holistic faculty information system to support the full lifecycle of faculty work, from job seeking to review, tenure, sabbatical, committee work, research, and beyond. Offering colleges and universities increased clarity and insight into faculty data to help achieve their strategic initiatives, Interfolio believes that advancing the faculty will advance the institution.

What’s even better than that?

We’ve crafted a fun, collegial, dynamic culture that celebrates team and individual success almost daily. We’ve got a lean team of super-smart, super-hard working, local and remote colleagues who collaborate closely to produce a valuable service for an industry we’re passionate about. And, we genuinely like working with each other and with our clients.

Like what you’ve heard so far?

Then consider joining our Services team. The position of Integrations (Data) Engineer is open to remote employees as well as locals in commuting distance to our Washington, D.C. office.

Interfolio is committed to diversity and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national, social or ethnic origin, age, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, family or parental status, or any status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate.

About the Position

The Integrations (Data) Engineer is a member of Interfolio Services team and is responsible for the data level integrations between client systems and their Interfolio products.. You will be responsible for building a team and defining best practices so that Interfolio can implement clients reliably and at increasing scale. Key attributes are a customer first mentality, an agile and adaptable mindset, self-motivated visionary spirit, capacity to give and receive constructive criticism, and a willingness to equally teach and learn.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Build the next generation of [Interfolio] ETL for Faculty180 using existing APIs, as well as additional API structures
  • Work with the business team to clarify requirements and provide effective technical designs aligning with industry best practices
  • Drive the design and implementation of scalable, high performing and robust ETL applications
  • Ensure a high level of quality through design and implementation of unit, system integration, and performance testing
  • Provide technical mentorship and guidance to more junior engineers
  • Conceptualize, develop and deploy data extraction procedures working collaboratively with new product clients
  • Develop recommendations for internal leadership around preferred data integration methodologies
  • Ensure barriers to accurate completion of Data Integration Services projects are anticipated and overcome
  • Work effectively with internal and external client project managers to ensure timely delivery of implementation
  • Build and foster strong relationships with all levels of technical and non-technical staff at client institutions
  • Identify, recognize, and act on opportunities for improvement in order to advance business goals
  • Confront problems, change, and/or challenges quickly and enthusiastically
  • Support and lead calls for prospective client partners around Interfolio’s data integration methodology
  • Developing validation master plans, process flow diagrams, test cases, and standard operating procedures
  • Analyzing validation test data to figure out whether systems or processes have met validation criteria
  • Performing root cause analysis
  • Coordinating the implementation or scheduling of validation testing with affected client departments and personnel
  • Crafting, populating, or maintaining databases for tracking validation activities, test results, or validated systems

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Experience architecting and delivering ETL services and analytics applications that use AWS Glue, Redshift, Athena or Aurora
  • Rest API development experience
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience
  • 4+ years of SQL knowledge, ideally on Postgres
  • Programming in any high level language, SQL scripts, and Java scripting
  • Understanding of fundamental software engineering, including data structures and programming constructs that would be found in non-trivial programs
  • Understanding of relational databases including intermediate level SQL
  • Basic understanding on internet protocols, networks, and related technologies, including http, xml, REST and Soap web services
  • Excellent customer communication and project management skills
  • Business Intelligence experience (Tableau, Sisense, Microstrategy, Qlik)
  • Big Data experience (AWS EMR)
  • Experience working in an Agile environment

In addition to a competitive salary, Interfolio offers a robust benefits package that includes medical insurance, unlimited PTO, a wellness benefit, 401k, and professional development opportunities. Our culture sets us apart—we look forward sharing more about our company and our team!

Apply now

About Interfolio, Inc

Interfolio is on a mission to build smart, inspired and useful products for faculty and academic communities. By building an engine for faculty activity, decisions, and data, Interfolio has become the first mover in defining and leading the category of faculty-focused technology that cultivates goal-oriented collaboration around academic decision-making.

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
  • 401K Plan
  • Professional Development Program
  • Life & Disability Coverage
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Wellness benefit stipend
  • Snacks in the office

items.title: TFS Build and Release Engineer - remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Summary

DevOps Engineering Operations is looking for a TFS Build and Release Engineer to assist with onboarding and support for .Net applications to the Continuous Integration and Delivery pipeline utilizing TFS Release Manager.

Responsibilities:

  • Acts as a lead in providing application design guidance and consultation, utilizing a thorough understanding of applicable technology, tools and existing designs.
  • Analyzes highly complex business requirements, designs and writes technical specifications to design or redesign complex computer platforms and applications.
  • Provides coding direction to less experienced staff or develops highly complex original code.
  • Acts as an expert technical resource for modeling, simulation and analysis efforts.
  • Verifies program logic by overseeing the preparation of test data, testing and debugging of programs.
  • Oversees overall systems testing and the migration of platforms and applications to production.
  • Develops new documentation, departmental technical procedures and user guides.
  • Leads projects, allocates and manages resources and manages the work of less experienced staff.
  • Assures quality, security and compliance requirements are met for supported area and oversees creation of or updates to and testing of the business continuation plan.

Required Experience

  • 8+ years of application development and implementation experience
  • 3+ years of experience with Continuous Integration with TFS Build (MUST HAVE version 2015 and/or 2017).
  • 3+ years of experience with Continuous Delivery with TFS Release Manager (MUST HAVE version 2015 and/or 2017).
  • Experience with TFS SCM including TFS-GIT
  • Prior Experience in Anthill Pro would be a plus
  • Experience partnering with key teams to ensure success (Architecture, PMO, Application Development teams)
  • Proven ability to effectively collaborate with others, initiate action, adapt to change, make difficult decisions, and accept challenging assignments and with the potential for constantly changing priorities and requirements.
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a highly collaborative, virtual environment with resources spread across the country with different time zones and work location including the potential for overseas, offshore resources.
  • Experience with continuously improve processes and services in a very dynamic and fast paced environment.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
    • provided by Dice tfs version 2015 and/or 2017, build and release, ci/cd, anthill pro, git

Interfolio


Integrations (Data) Engineer

Interfolio operates the first holistic faculty information system to support the full lifecycle of faculty work, from job seeking to review, tenure, sabbatical, committee work, research, and beyond. We’ve got a lean team of super-smart, super-hard working, local and remote colleagues who collaborate closely to produce a valuable service for an industry we’re passionate about. And, we genuinely like working with each other and with our clients.

Like what you’ve heard so far?

Then consider joining our Services team. The position of Integrations (Data) Engineer is open to remote employees as well as locals in commuting distance to our Washington, D.C. office.

Interfolio is committed to diversity and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national, social or ethnic origin, age, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, family or parental status, or any status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate.

About the Position

The Integrations (Data) Engineer is a member of Interfolio Services team and is responsible for the data level integrations between client systems and their Interfolio products.. You will be responsible for building a team and defining best practices so that Interfolio can implement clients reliably and at increasing scale. Key attributes are a customer first mentality, an agile and adaptable mindset, self-motivated visionary spirit, capacity to give and receive constructive criticism, and a willingness to equally teach and learn.

Primary Responsibilities:


* Build the next generation of [Interfolio] ETL for Faculty180 using existing APIs, as well as additional API structures

* Work with the business team to clarify requirements and provide effective technical designs aligning with industry best practices

* Drive the design and implementation of scalable, high performing and robust ETL applications

* Ensure a high level of quality through design and implementation of unit, system integration, and performance testing

* Provide technical mentorship and guidance to more junior engineers

* Conceptualize, develop and deploy data extraction procedures working collaboratively with new product clients

* Develop recommendations for internal leadership around preferred data integration methodologies

* Ensure barriers to accurate completion of Data Integration Services projects are anticipated and overcome

* Work effectively with internal and external client project managers to ensure timely delivery of implementation

* Build and foster strong relationships with all levels of technical and non-technical staff at client institutions

* Identify, recognize, and act on opportunities for improvement in order to advance business goals

* Confront problems, change, and/or challenges quickly and enthusiastically

* Support and lead calls for prospective client partners around Interfolio’s data integration methodology

* Developing validation master plans, process flow diagrams, test cases, and standard operating procedures

* Analyzing validation test data to figure out whether systems or processes have met validation criteria

* Performing root cause analysis

* Coordinating the implementation or scheduling of validation testing with affected client departments and personnel

* Crafting, populating, or maintaining databases for tracking validation activities, test results, or validated systems




Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree

* Experience architecting and delivering ETL services and analytics applications that use AWS Glue, Redshift, Athena or Aurora

* Rest API development experience

* 5+ years of professional software development experience

* 4+ years of SQL knowledge, ideally on Postgres

* Programming in any high level language, SQL scripts, and Java scripting

* Understanding of fundamental software engineering, including data structures and programming constructs that would be found in non-trivial programs

* Understanding of relational databases including intermediate level SQL

* Basic understanding on internet protocols, networks, and related technologies, including http, xml, REST and Soap web services

* Excellent customer communication and project management skills

* Business Intelligence experience (Tableau, Sisense, Microstrategy, Qlik)

* Big Data experience (AWS EMR)

* Experience working in an Agile environment




In addition to a competitive salary, Interfolio offers a robust benefits package that includes medical insurance, unlimited PTO, a wellness benefit, 401k, and professional development opportunities. Our culture sets us apart—we look forward sharing more about our company and our team!

See more jobs at Interfolio

items.title: Swiftype Integrations Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=72, embedded=0, frontend=26}
items.content:
Swiftype Integrations Engineer


Elastic


At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Swiftype is a growing team of talented search engineers with a range of experiences and backgrounds. As an Integrations Engineer at Swiftype, you will take on a variety of responsibilities that will range from building example applications to showcasing the power and flexibility of the Swiftype Search platform. You'll communicate directly with customers in order to intuitively assess their needs, helping them to achieve their search goals while also refining our developer tools and knowledge base. If you see yourself as much a teacher as a coder, this position will be a terrific fit for you.

What You Will Do:


* Excellent practical judgment. You should know how to effectively allocate your time when solving hard problems.

* Experience working with one or more of WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.

* Working knowledge of PHP.

* Deep knowledge of a scripting language such as Ruby, JavaScript, or Python.

* Experience working with Git and a command line.

* Excellent communication skills.

* Strong attention to detail.




What You Bring Along:


* 2+ years experience as a web developer.

* Experience building plugins for or customizing WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.

* A passion for user experience and crafting intuitive interactions on the web.

* Experience with JavaScript tooling and libraries, like React, Vue, and jQuery.

* Experience working with REST/JSON APIs.

* Experience using browser tools to test, profile, and debug modern web applications.

* Experience gathering requirements from modern design tools like Figma and Sketch.

* Experience working with Customer Support and incorporating feedback.

* Familiarity with Open Source projects and communities.

* Experience writing technical blog posts and presenting at conferences.




If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code examples, links to personal projects, etc.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.


* Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary

* Stock options

* Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)

* Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off

* Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.





Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.



See more jobs at Elastic

items.title: Senior Data Integration Engineer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Are you a data nerd? If so we want you!

We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Non Profits, Charities and Art Galleries. We’re on the lookout for a confident and ambitious Data Integration Engineer to join our fast growing startup to help us build and automate complex data integrations for our clients and platforms.

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, offer a great work-life balance with flexible working hours and a real team mentality.

Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, art galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies.

The role will comprise of 2 main elements. Most of our projects will involve a degree of data integration or migration and so we are looking to have a dedicated member of the team to work on these elements of the projects. We want to develop an automated and scalable architecture that can be used in a flexible way across large client projects.

The other element of the role will be to be part of the infrastructure team in a devops/sysadmin capacity. You would also become a key architect in helping us to develop a robust SAS platform for a major SaaS product we are developing for Non Profit Organisations around the world.

The ideal candidate will have:

Excellent SQL skills
Experience of building ETL solutions using Python (2+ years), Apache Airflow, or applicable experience with other Extract Transform and Load tools such as Pentaho, Talend*
Confidence in a Linux & PHP (LAMP/LEMP) Environment
Previous experience with CI/DevOps tools platforms (i.e. Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Ansible) nice to have
Is meticulous and loves documentation!
Is a real team player who likes to muck in and get the job done!

*Most of our latest tools are Python based and as such we have a preference for Python skills.

What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a young team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right and are looking for someone who thinks and acts like us.
If you live and breath SQL and know your left joins from your inner joins then we would love to hear from you.

Location

At Compucorp we are a distributed team and we welcome people to join us from all around the world, however as a UK based Company some overlap with UK hours will be required. By default you should assume that your working hours would be +/- 3h max from GMT start times of 9.00AM UK start time. There is some flexibility in this but please be aware that staff members starting outside of these hours are rare and as such if you would expect these hours to be an issue for you then we would not suggest that you apply. For the Data Engineer role, due to EU data protection requirements, the team member must be from either an EEA country or a country that the EU considers to have adequate level of data protection. The list can be found at the link below: 

https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-topic/data-protection/data-transfers-outside-eu/adequacy-protection-personal-data-non-eu-countries_en

To apply, please follow the link below:

https://www.compucorp.co.uk/content/application-form-data-integration-engineer

items.title: Lead Automation Developer in Test
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=18, c=4, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Who we are

Altus Group is a leading provider of software, data solutions and independent advisory services to the global commercial real estate industry. Our businesses, Altus Analytics and Altus Expert Services, empower clients to analyse, gain market insight and recognise value on their real estate investments. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,300 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific.

Altus Analytics, the software and data solutions division of Altus Group, is driving an evolution in the commercial real estate industry by empowering clients and partners with industry standard software solutions, data products and technology enabled services.

The opportunity

We are looking for a Lead Automation Developer in Test to join our Core Services team and work across three significant global products. We need a hands-on Lead Developer in Test who understands how to test web services and has experience creating both UI and API test frameworks with Selenium webdriver and C#. Someone who can share their knowledge, introduce best practices, create and coordinate automation in testing. We need a Lead Automation Developer in Test who realises the full potential of automation testing and strives to improve the framework through new insights or existing flaws. We want a champion of Behaviour-Driven Development (BDD) and a forward thinker. Someone who knows the value of automation in Agile software development and the importance of QA to engineer valuable tests. A Lead Automation Developer in Test who can liaise with all sides of the business to get the best results. This is an opportunity to drive and extend Automation for our new platform; to lead the work of remote automation engineers in India; and to build out your role and the team.

Who you are

You are a hands-on team leader and a thought leader; a Developer and an Automation test specialist. You are looking for an opportunity to join a rapidly growing organization. You may be working as a consultant for a large corporation as part of a team focused on web services implementation. You know how to build relationships and frameworks; how to collaborate across teams and how to create testing in different environments. You have end-to-end project work experience where you worked building and testing Front End Automation frameworks and API Web Services. You have experience determining when and how testing needs to occur; organizing testing; and converting manual to automation.

What’s in it for you

- Influence. You want to join a rapidly scaling PropTech leader where you can influence and drive the Automation testing of multiple global products. You want to have your opinion valued and have a say in the tools and the processes.
- Knowledge and growth. We are passionate about technology and as the industry leaders in Prop Tech, we know the future is in Automation and the cloud. As we grow, you will have an opportunity to build out an Automation Test team and to work on additional products.
- Exposure. This is an opportunity to be part of rolling out a unique platform and many products that will support and positively impact users in PropTech around the world.

Here’s what our Lead Automation Developer in Test will do:

- Provide supervision, guidance and day to day oversight to the offshore QA Automation team.
- Automate Functional UI and API tests.
- Performance, Scalability and Load tests.
- Manage the nightly automated test build on Jenkins.
- Coordinate the automation tasks in Jira within the team, including code management using Git.
- Work with other members of the QA Team to develop automation across all areas of the system including financial reports, database, UI and Excel integration.
- Provide support and training in automation.
- Establish best practices for automation, maintain high code quality and drive processes to enable smooth and efficient automation.
- Actively participate in team meetings; set and meet sprint deliverables.
- Work alongside the development team and product management team to obtain clarification on requirements and functionality and resolve all issues as efficiently as possible.
- Conduct research, suggest solutions, and generally do whatever it takes.

Position Requirements:

How do we know that’s you? You are:

- A university graduate. You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science.
- An experienced Developer. You have expertise in SQL, .NET, either C# or Java and building software automation using Selenium WebDriver. You have worked on designing and implementing automation frameworks from end-to-end on multiple complex projects. You have experience testing web services and applications with Gherkin format; creating and testing API frameworks; and testing Front End with NJOY. You have deep knowledge of cloud technology.
- An innovative problem-solver. You think creatively in testing commercial grade software. You have exposure to multiple products and tools and you enjoy researching new methods. You have a range of experience implementing and maintaining an automation testing framework and you are able to offer guidance and advice based on deep knowledge of automation testing techniques and tools.
- A leader. You are results-driven, with initiative and highly capable of meeting deadlines. You can motivate and support the work of local and offshore teams. You thrive in a fast-paced environment. Experience leading remote teams is an asset.
- A strong communicator. You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You can build positive relationships with stakeholders, end users and members of a project team.

Altus Analytics is:

- Fast. We are responsive and fast, working in a startup-like environment, developing new solutions and features that meet the demands of our users. With the solid financial stability of our bigger parent-group, we can offer the best of both worlds - cool tech, great benefits, challenges and rewards.
- First. We continuously innovate to stay ahead of our competitors. We set the standard for the CRE industry.
- Fun. From social Fridays to summer sailing; from holiday parties to mid-winter hackathons, we know how to take a step back and relax with co-workers.
- Future-focused. As an organisation, we are focused on growing our reach and our product offering. For anyone joining us, this means the chance to work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients and grow your own career moving up to the next level, choosing to specialise or exploring different product teams.
- We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn.


Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs.
